task.summary: Default task
Login and signUp now working!
Changes to sign in - Client now stores user who signed in and an ArrayList of online Users
Some progress made on updating online users within client
Updates to allow online users to be accessed by Client including supporting code for online clients to be updated on both server and client when list changes (i.e. a user signs in or disconnects).
Fix for bug where sign up caused issues with online user list
NOTE: Not fully working - just ensuring latest code is committed!
Core user messaging code written, needs to be integrated with DB code.
First attempt to pull together chat client/server and DB code
fixed after merge
Server to database methods to support messaging are now working.
Changes to messaging to improve efficiency...
Made classes serializable to enable protocol messages to be sent without error
added writeToServerNoReturn() to client
Conversations fix
Fix to checkConversations method
Fix to DB method used to check conversation participants
silly issues noticed in db method!! fixed
More changes to support user messaging
Fixes to messaging - client side
Test with Map of Strings rather than user objects

MAJOR CHANGES TO CHAT CONTROLLER...
Please be aware that at first this may appear to be a step backwards but I really do not think it is - I have managed to implement true model view separation within chat controller / client classes.
Plus side, data is now always consistent, i.e. when I send a message, the conversation ID is retrieved directly from model so is getting associated to correct conversation every time (no longer using an out of date conversation ID and storing things incorrectly in DB). Also user list is updating via model view separation (i.e. model is no longer calling chatController, a listener is handling this and working!
Downside, chats still not populating within GUI. On reflection I am confident that backend code is working as it should, earlier attempts to hack together were fruitless. Basically I think we should persevere with model view separation as per this commit. We can potentially look at displaying messages differently...
Basically we shouldn't stress too much - underlying application is working as it should, we just need to put some extra thought in to the views.
SO CLOOOOOSSSSSEEE!!!!
Chat between 2 users working!!!!
CHAT FULLY WORKING!!! Changed some DB code to ensure correct user messages pulled back, also added check to ensure same user cannot login twice.
Added email at sign up

Added listener to check for new messages from other clients - check the notification() method within ChatController - this is successfully being called at the appropriate time (i.e. is listening to the correct model event).
If you look at the method you will see that we know who the last user to have sent a message to this user is.
We need to send an appropriate notification to this user that they have received a message from the user that is currently printing.
Ideally we should check to see if this is the currently selected user, if it is we should call setChatView() to refresh this users view and see the new message, else we should display some form of notification - maybe some text somewhere on the GUI?
Please note, we should avoid storing model data within the ChatController as this is likely to become out of sync. Look to use the client object as this will always be correct.
commit with comments

screen automatically updates if message received from selected user. Terminal prints out to ping a notification if not selected - need to put appropriate code in here to tell the user whose contacted them etc.
This should be easy now as client has currentlySelectedUser & lastReceivedUser. Call LoginController.client.get... to see these and make decisions.
Clean up / authoring of classes & interfaces

Efficiency changes!! When a user requests a conversation it will now always be sent to both members of the conversation and will be handled appropriately on receiving end. This allows for users to load conversations locally rather than from server even if they have not yet selected a user (i.e. that user has selected them).
removed Email.class...

Fixes:
Chat now loading locally after initially retrieved from server / db and presenting correctly.
Client should now have underlying code to understand when the server is unavailable and react accordingly (e.g. I have added listeners to model, these are instantiated when controllers are initialized etc. The code needs to be added to the controllers to react appropriately via the view.
Also I realised the Server was not shutting down entirely when 'disconnecting' via GUI, this was due to an issue whereby the ClientRequestHandler get's stuck (it gets stuck because it should get stuck - it waits listening for a client connection so is necessary that it acts in this way), to get around this the disconnect button will now close the window as it runs System.exit(). Works for our purposes!!
Fixes to ensure Client / server can handle loss of each other
password reset...
Message classes required for password reset etc.
FIX - 2 password reset messages were being sent by Client, now fixed.
with comments for GUI
fixed server GUI to only accept valid inputs
commit to pull!!
notifications and change of time format
Change password working
fix to notifications
Status now updating in the DB, update getting sent to clients - just need to actappropriately on receipt of updated status

Status update working, BUT for some reason it is clearing the chat view when clicking update status... Need to figure out why, have tried calling setChatView() in same code block but this has not fixed the issue...
More notifications / status updated - appear to be issues with chatview
final commit before Presentation other than javadoc
notifications and statuses fully working! (well...)
Last minute fixes

MESSAGE.value: Added email at sign up

Added listener to check for new messages from other clients - check the notification() method within ChatController - this is successfully being called at the appropriate time (i.e. is listening to the correct model event).
If you look at the method you will see that we know who the last user to have sent a message to this user is.
We need to send an appropriate notification to this user that they have received a message from the user that is currently printing.
Ideally we should check to see if this is the currently selected user, if it is we should call setChatView() to refresh this users view and see the new message, else we should display some form of notification - maybe some text somewhere on the GUI?
Please note, we should avoid storing model data within the ChatController as this is likely to become out of sync. Look to use the client object as this will always be correct.

screen automatically updates if message received from selected user. Terminal prints out to ping a notification if not selected - need to put appropriate code in here to tell the user whose contacted them etc.
This should be easy now as client has currentlySelectedUser & lastReceivedUser. Call LoginController.client.get... to see these and make decisions.
Clean up / authoring of classes & interfaces

Efficiency changes!! When a user requests a conversation it will now always be sent to both members of the conversation and will be handled appropriately on receiving end. This allows for users to load conversations locally rather than from server even if they have not yet selected a user (i.e. that user has selected them).
removed Email.class...

Fixes:
Chat now loading locally after initially retrieved from server / db and presenting correctly.
Client should now have underlying code to understand when the server is unavailable and react accordingly (e.g. I have added listeners to model, these are instantiated when controllers are initialized etc. The code needs to be added to the controllers to react appropriately via the view.
Also I realised the Server was not shutting down entirely when 'disconnecting' via GUI, this was due to an issue whereby the ClientRequestHandler get's stuck (it gets stuck because it should get stuck - it waits listening for a client connection so is necessary that it acts in this way), to get around this the disconnect button will now close the window as it runs System.exit(). Works for our purposes!!
Fixes to ensure Client / server can handle loss of each other
